greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Let a(1)=0. Then a(i+1)=position of first occurrence of a(i) in decimal expansion of log 2.
example: For example, a(2)=9 because the 9th digit of log 2 after decimal point is 0 and this is the first occurrence of 0.
a(3)=2 because 2nd decimal digit of log 2 is 9, a(4)=22 because 22nd decimal digit of log 2 is 2 and so on.
xref: Cf. A098266 (for e recurrence), A097614 (for Pi recurrence).
results.author: Mark Hudson (mrmarkhudson(AT)hotmail.com), Sep 02 2004
ext: Edited by _N. J. A. Sloane_, Oct 15 2006
More terms from _Charles R Greathouse IV_, Oct 09 2006
